poem:
A Cry in Silence

In cracked gray walls
the whispering minds 
are shadows grasping 
for light, unspoken 
pleas lost in corridors,
underfunded, unseen—
ghosts of care 
folded into dark 
pockets of neglect,
where a scream 
is just the rustling 
of brittle leaves 
in an abandoned 
autumn.
